title: Marissa Gill
text:
Welcome
Welcome to my website! My name is Marissa Gill and I am an undergraduate student at the University of California, Santa Barbara. I am currently pursuing degrees in both Hydrologic Science and Policy, and Geography with an Emphasis in Geographic Information Systems (GIS).


Areas of Interest
Stream Ecology | Groundwater | Surface-water | Water Policy and Management | Environmental Consulting | Geographic Information Systems | Habitat Reconstruction Efforts

title: About Me
text:
Academic Interests
My academic interests include water policy and management, watershed dynamics and the application of GIS to address environmental challenges in a visual way. Iâ€™m also gaining hands-on experience with tools like Microsoft Excel, ArcGIS, and R.


Campus Involvement
I am actively involved in the Hydrology club at UCSB, and serve as both treasurer and secretary on the Executive board. As a cofounder of the club in 2023 I work with the team to organize water-related events and connect with professionals in the field of hydrology on and off campus.


Outside the Classroom
In my personal time I love cooking new recipes and eating healthy and fufilling meals. I also love nature and dabble in landscape photography, especially since attending school near the ocean. I also love animals and on a free weekend like to visit the Santa Barbara Humane Society to adopt a dog and spoil them for the day!




My dog and I at the beach, Spring 2024.


Chicken coconut curry with vegetables and rice.


Photograph from a boat in Puerto Vallarta Mexico, Fall 2022.


Volunteering with the Santa Barbara Humane Shelter, taking a rescue out of the shelter for the day and on a walk.


Executive team of the Hydrology Club at UCSB presenting at the 55th Bren Hall Anniversary to faculty and alumni, Spring 2025.
